title: Getting Started with Mojo Dialer
content:
Welcome to Mojo Dialer! Mojo is a comprehensive power dialing system designed specifically for real estate professionals to maximize their prospecting efficiency.

Getting Started Steps:
1. Sign up for an account at mojosells.com
2. Choose your plan (Single, Triple, or Enterprise)
3. Download the Mojo mobile app from iOS App Store or Google Play Store, or access the web interface at app.mojosells.com
4. Complete your profile setup including your name, email, and phone number
5. Import your first batch of leads and contacts
6. Configure your dialer settings including caller ID selection
7. Set up your voicemail drop messages for efficiency
8. Start dialing!

Training Resources:
Join our live training webinars Monday through Friday at 11am and 3pm EST. These interactive sessions cover everything from basic setup to advanced features. You can register at lb11.mojosells.com/single/training-webinars/

The Power Dialer will automatically call through your contact list, allowing you to focus on having conversations rather than manually dialing numbers. For mobile users, make sure to whitelist the dialer server numbers so they show up as 'Mojo Dialer' on your phone.

title: How to Import Contacts into Mojo
content:
Importing contacts into Mojo is straightforward and supports various data sources.

Import Process:
1. Navigate to Contacts menu and click Import
2. Download the CSV template provided
3. Fill in your contact information following the template format

Required Fields:
- Name (First Name and/or Last Name)
- At least one phone number

Optional Fields:
- Email address
- Mailing address (Street, City, State, ZIP)
- Property address
- Tags and categories
- Custom fields
- Notes

Import Limits:
- You can import up to 10,000 contacts at once
- For larger imports, split your file into multiple batches
- CSV file size limit: 50MB

Duplicate Handling:
Mojo automatically detects duplicates based on phone number and name. During import, you can choose to:
- Skip duplicates (keep existing records)
- Update duplicates (merge new information)
- Create duplicates anyway (not recommended)

Data Sources:
Mojo integrates with popular lead sources including:
- Vulcan7
- REIPro
- PropStream
- ListSource
- RedX
- Manual CSV imports

After import, contacts are immediately available for dialing. Use filters and tags to organize your lists effectively.

title: Power Dialer Setup and Configuration
content:
The Mojo Power Dialer is the core feature that automates your calling process, dramatically increasing your productivity.

Dialer Modes:

1. Triple Line Dialing
- Calls 3 phone numbers simultaneously
- Automatically connects you to the first person who answers
- Other lines disconnect when one connects
- Recommended ratio: 2:1 or 3:1
- Best for: High-volume prospecting

2. Single Line Dialing
- Calls one number at a time
- More controlled pace
- Better for warm leads
- Recommended for: Callbacks and follow-ups

3. Click-to-Call (Nurture Dialer)
- Manual dialing with one click
- Full control over each call
- Best for: High-value contacts and appointments

Setup Steps:
1. Go to Settings > Dialer Configuration
2. Select your dialing mode
3. Set your dial ratio (how many lines to dial per agent)
4. Choose your caller ID - use your own number or a Mojo-provided number
5. Configure call results and dispositions
6. Set up voicemail drop messages
7. Choose your call list or apply filters
8. Click 'Start Dialing'

Caller ID Options:
- Use your personal mobile number
- Use a Mojo-provided local presence number
- Rotate between multiple numbers
- Match area code to the contact being called

Voicemail Drop:
Record pre-recorded messages that can be dropped with one click when you reach voicemail. This saves 30-60 seconds per voicemail.

Call Results:
Customize your call dispositions including:
- Contact Made
- Left Message
- Wrong Number
- Do Not Call
- Appointment Set
- Follow-Up Scheduled

The dialer automatically moves to the next contact after logging a call result, maintaining your momentum throughout the session.

title: Troubleshooting Audio Issues
content:
Audio problems can significantly impact your dialing session. Here are comprehensive solutions for common audio issues.

No Audio During Calls:

1. Check Browser Permissions
- Chrome: Click the lock icon in address bar > Site settings > Allow microphone
- Safari: Safari menu > Settings for this Website > Microphone > Allow
- Firefox: Click the microphone icon in address bar > Allow

2. System Permissions
- Mac: System Preferences > Security & Privacy > Privacy > Microphone
- Windows: Settings > Privacy > Microphone > Allow apps to access microphone
- Check that your browser is listed and enabled

3. Hardware Check
- Ensure headset is properly connected
- Try unplugging and reconnecting
- Test with a different USB port
- Verify headset works with other applications

4. Browser Troubleshooting
- Clear browser cache and cookies
- Disable browser extensions temporarily
- Try incognito/private mode
- Update to the latest browser version
- Restart the browser completely

Echo or Feedback:

1. Always use a headset instead of speakers
2. Ensure only one audio device is active
3. Check for duplicate browser tabs with Mojo open
4. Reduce microphone sensitivity in system settings
5. Move away from hard surfaces that cause echo

Poor Call Quality:

1. Internet Connection
- Minimum required: 1 Mbps download and upload
- Recommended: 5+ Mbps for optimal quality
- Test your speed at speedtest.net
- Close bandwidth-heavy applications (streaming, downloads)
- Consider upgrading your internet plan

2. Network Optimization
- Use wired Ethernet connection instead of WiFi when possible
- If using WiFi, stay close to the router
- Reduce number of devices on your network
- Restart your router/modem
- Enable QoS (Quality of Service) on your router for VoIP priority

3. Computer Performance
- Close unnecessary applications
- Restart your computer if it's been running for days
- Check CPU usage (should be under 80%)
- Ensure sufficient RAM availability

Caller Cannot Hear You:

1. Unmute your microphone in system settings
2. Check that correct microphone is selected in Mojo settings
3. Test microphone level - speak and watch for activity indicator
4. Try a different microphone or headset
5. Update audio drivers

Mobile App Audio Issues:

1. iOS
- Settings > Mojo > Enable Microphone
- Settings > Privacy > Microphone > Enable for Mojo
- Check Do Not Disturb is off
- Ensure Ring/Silent switch is set to Ring

2. Android
- Settings > Apps > Mojo > Permissions > Microphone > Allow
- Check that Battery Optimization is disabled for Mojo
- Clear app cache: Settings > Apps > Mojo > Storage > Clear Cache

3. Both Platforms
- Force quit and restart the app
- Uninstall and reinstall if problems persist
- Check for app updates in the store
- Verify cellular or WiFi connection is strong

If issues persist after trying these solutions, contact Mojo support with details about:
- Your operating system and version
- Browser type and version
- Headset model
- When the issue started
- Error messages received

title: Email Integration and Sending
content:
Mojo's email integration allows you to communicate with contacts directly from the platform, with full tracking and automation capabilities.

Email Setup:

1. Connect Your Email Account
- Navigate to Settings > Email Integration
- Click 'Connect Email Account'
- Choose your provider (Gmail, Outlook, or SMTP)
- Complete OAuth authorization
- For Gmail: Allow Mojo to send email on your behalf
- For Outlook: Sign in with Microsoft account
- For SMTP: Enter server details (host, port, username, password)

2. Supported Email Providers
- Gmail/Google Workspace (recommended)
- Outlook/Office 365
- Yahoo Mail
- Custom SMTP servers

Email Templates:

Create reusable templates to save time:
1. Go to Settings > Email Templates
2. Click 'New Template'
3. Add a name (e.g., 'Initial Contact - FSBO')
4. Write your email using merge fields
5. Test the template before using

Merge Fields:
Personalize emails automatically:
- {FirstName} - Contact's first name
- {LastName} - Contact's last name
- {FullName} - Full name
- {Address} - Property address
- {City}, {State}, {ZipCode}
- {Email}, {Phone}
- {AgentName} - Your name
- {AgentPhone} - Your phone
- {AgentEmail} - Your email
- {CompanyName} - Your company

Example template:
"Hi {FirstName},

I noticed your property at {Address} is available. I'd love to discuss how I can help you...

Best regards,
{AgentName}
{AgentPhone}"

Sending Emails:

1. Single Email
- Open contact record
- Click 'Send Email'
- Select template or compose new
- Review and send

2. Bulk Email
- Go to Contacts or Lists
- Filter your target audience
- Select contacts (or select all)
- Click 'Actions' > 'Send Email'
- Choose template
- Preview merge fields
- Schedule or send immediately

Email Tracking:

- Opens: Know when recipient opens your email
- Clicks: Track link clicks in your email
- Bounces: Identify invalid email addresses
- Replies: Automatic notification of responses

All tracking data appears in the contact's activity history.

Email Features:

1. Attachments
- Attach documents up to 25MB
- Support for PDFs, images, Word docs
- Store frequently used attachments in library

2. HTML Templates
- Rich formatting options
- Add images and logos
- Include clickable buttons
- Mobile-responsive design

3. Scheduling
- Schedule emails for future delivery
- Set optimal send times
- Respect time zones automatically

4. Drip Campaigns
- Automate email sequences
- Set delays between emails
- Trigger based on contact actions
- Part of Action Plans (see Action Plans article)

Best Practices:

1. Deliverability
- Always include an unsubscribe link
- Avoid spam trigger words
- Don't send to purchased lists
- Maintain good sender reputation
- Warm up new email accounts gradually

2. Compliance
- Follow CAN-SPAM Act requirements
- Include physical mailing address
- Honor unsubscribe requests within 10 days
- Don't use deceptive subject lines

3. Timing
- Best send times: Tuesday-Thursday, 10am-2pm local time
- Avoid Mondays (inbox overload) and Fridays (weekend mode)
- Test different times for your audience

Troubleshooting:

- Emails going to spam: Check SPF, DKIM, and DMARC records
- Connection issues: Reauthorize your email account
- Bounced emails: Verify email addresses are correct
- Low open rates: Improve subject lines, check send times

For advanced email automation, explore Action Plans which can trigger emails based on contact behavior and schedule.

title: Do Not Call (DNC) List Management
content:
Managing Do Not Call (DNC) compliance is critical to avoid legal penalties and maintain professionalism. Mojo provides comprehensive DNC management tools.

Federal DNC Registry:

Mojo automatically scrubs your contacts against the National Do Not Call Registry.

1. Automatic Monthly Updates
- Mojo downloads the latest Federal DNC list monthly
- Your contacts are automatically checked
- DNC contacts are flagged and protected from dialing

2. Manual DNC Check
- Go to Settings > DNC > Federal DNC
- Click 'Check Now' to run immediate comparison
- Review flagged contacts
- Export DNC list for compliance records

State DNC Lists:

Some states maintain separate DNC registries:
- Florida
- Missouri
- Tennessee
- Others

To import state lists:
1. Download state DNC file from state website
2. Go to Settings > DNC > State Lists
3. Upload the file
4. Mojo processes and flags matching contacts

Internal DNC List:

Maintain your own DNC list for contacts who request not to be called:

1. Mark Individual Contact as DNC
- Open contact record
- Click 'Mark as DNC'
- Select reason: 'Requested', 'Wrong Number', 'Deceased', or 'Other'
- Add notes if needed
- Save

2. Bulk DNC Management
- Select multiple contacts
- Actions > Mark as DNC
- Choose reason
- Confirm

3. DNC by Phone Number
- Settings > DNC > Add Number
- Enter phone number
- Select reason
- Future contacts with this number are automatically flagged

Litigator List:

Protect against professional litigators who sue telemarketers:

1. Automatic Scrubbing
- Mojo includes litigator list scrubbing
- Updated regularly
- Flagged contacts cannot be dialed

2. Manual Upload
- If you have your own litigator list
- Settings > DNC > Litigator List
- Upload CSV file
- Format: PhoneNumber, Name (optional)

Power Dialer DNC Protection:

The Power Dialer automatically skips DNC numbers:
- Federal DNC Registry numbers
- State DNC numbers
- Internal DNC list
- Litigator list
- Manually marked DNC contacts

DNC indicators appear clearly:
- Red 'DNC' badge on contact records
- Warning if you try to manually dial DNC number
- DNC contacts excluded from dial lists

Compliance Reporting:

Maintain compliance records:

1. Export DNC List
- Settings > DNC > Export
- Choose format: CSV or PDF
- Includes all DNC sources
- Timestamped for record-keeping

2. Audit Trail
- Every DNC action is logged
- View who marked contact as DNC and when
- Contact history shows DNC status changes

Best Practices:

1. Honor Requests Immediately
- If someone asks not to be called, mark them DNC right away
- Don't wait until end of day
- Document the request in contact notes

2. Check Before Calling
- Always check contact for DNC status before manual calls
- Trust the Power Dialer's automatic screening

3. Train Your Team
- Ensure all agents understand DNC compliance
- Review procedures regularly
- Make compliance part of onboarding

4. Regular Audits
- Monthly review of DNC procedures
- Check that auto-scrubbing is working
- Verify state lists are current

Legal Penalties:

Violations carry serious penalties:
- Federal: Up to $43,280 per violation
- State penalties vary but can be equally severe
- Multiple violations can accumulate quickly

Established Business Relationship Exception:

- You may call past clients within 18 months of last transaction
- Inquiries give 3-month window
- Exception doesn't apply if they explicitly request DNC
- Maintain records proving the relationship

For questions about specific situations or exemptions, consult with a compliance attorney specializing in telemarketing law.

title: Action Plans and Automated Follow-Up
content:
Action Plans automate your follow-up process, ensuring consistent contact with leads over time without manual effort.

What is an Action Plan?

An Action Plan is an automated sequence of tasks and communications that execute over a specified timeframe. Think of it as a drip campaign combined with task management.

Action Plan Components:

1. Drip Emails
- Automatically sent at scheduled intervals
- Use templates with merge fields
- Track opens and clicks
- Can branch based on engagement

2. Tasks
- Call reminders
- Text message prompts
- Direct mail reminders
- Custom task types

3. Wait Steps
- Time delays between actions
- Days, weeks, or months
- Business days vs calendar days

4. SMS Messages
- Automated text messages
- Personalized with merge fields
- Respects opt-in requirements

5. Voicemail Drops
- Pre-recorded messages
- Delivered on schedule
- Saves time on follow-ups

Creating an Action Plan:

1. Navigate to Action Plans > Create New
2. Name your plan (e.g., "FSBO 90-Day Nurture")
3. Choose category (optional organization)
4. Click 'Add Step'

Step Types:

- Email: Send drip email
- Task: Create reminder for agent
- SMS: Send text message
- Wait: Add time delay
- Conditional: Branch based on criteria

Example Action Plan Structure:

Day 1: Introduction email
Wait 3 days
Day 4: Follow-up email with market data
Wait 1 week
Day 11: Task to call contact
Wait 4 days
Day 15: Case study email
Wait 2 weeks
Day 29: Task to send direct mail
Wait 1 week
Day 36: Check-in email
...continue pattern

Assigning Contacts to Action Plans:

1. Manual Assignment
- Open contact record
- Click 'Add to Action Plan'
- Select plan
- Set start date (usually immediately)
- Confirm

2. Bulk Assignment
- Select multiple contacts from list
- Actions > Add to Action Plan
- Choose plan
- All contacts start the sequence

3. Automatic Assignment
- Set up rules to auto-assign
- Based on lead source, status, tags, etc.
- Settings > Automation > Action Plan Rules

Monitoring Action Plans:

Dashboard shows:
- Active plans by contact
- Upcoming tasks
- Email performance (opens, clicks)
- Completion rates
- Next scheduled action per contact

Contact Actions:
- View all contacts in a plan
- See where each contact is in the sequence
- Pause or resume for specific contacts
- Skip steps if needed
- Remove contacts from plan

Advanced Features:

1. Conditional Branches
- If contact opens email → Path A
- If no open after 7 days → Path B
- Based on call results
- Based on tags or status changes

2. Multi-Touch Coordination
- Coordinate with live calling
- Pause during active dialing
- Resume after call sequence

3. Team Assignment
- Round-robin task distribution
- Assign steps to specific agents
- Territory-based routing

Use Case Examples:

1. FSBO Follow-Up (90 days)
- Weekly emails with tips and market updates
- Bi-weekly call tasks
- Monthly direct mail reminders
- Case studies and testimonials
- Goal: Convert to listing

2. Expired Listing Campaign (60 days)
- Immediate email: "I saw your listing expired"
- Day 3: Market analysis
- Day 7: Call task
- Day 14: Success stories
- Day 21: Pricing strategy email
- Goal: Win the re-list

3. Sphere of Influence Touch Plan (365 days)
- Monthly market updates
- Quarterly "just checking in" calls
- Birthday/anniversary emails
- Holiday cards
- Goal: Stay top-of-mind for referrals

4. New Lead Nurture (30 days)
- Day 1: Welcome email
- Day 2: Call task
- Day 5: Property search tips
- Day 10: Neighborhood guide
- Day 15: Call task
- Day 20: Financing info
- Day 30: Schedule showing task

Best Practices:

1. Start Simple
- Begin with 5-7 touchpoints
- Test before assigning to many contacts
- Refine based on results

2. Provide Value
- Every email should offer something useful
- Market data, tips, local insights
- Don't just ask for business

3. Mix Communication Types
- Combine emails, calls, texts
- Use different media types
- Variety keeps engagement high

4. Monitor and Adjust
- Track open and response rates
- Remove steps that don't perform
- Test different timings
- A/B test email content

5. Know When to Stop
- Define exit criteria
- Remove unengaged contacts after X days
- Respect unsubscribe requests immediately

6. Personalization
- Use merge fields extensively
- Segment by property type, price range, location
- Custom plans for different lead sources

Integrations:

Action Plans work with:
- Power Dialer (auto-pause during calls)
- Email tracking
- SMS platform
- Calendar (tasks appear automatically)
- Call results (trigger next steps)

Compliance Notes:

- Emails must include unsubscribe link
- SMS requires prior opt-in
- Follow CAN-SPAM Act
- Respect state telemarketing hours
- Honor DNC requests immediately

Action Plans are one of Mojo's most powerful features for automating consistent follow-up while maintaining a personal touch. Agents using Action Plans effectively can nurture hundreds of leads simultaneously without dropping the ball.

title: Mojo Mobile App (Mojo on the Go)
content:
The Mojo mobile app, called 'Mojo on the Go,' brings the power of Mojo Dialer to your iOS or Android device, allowing you to prospect from anywhere.

Downloading the App:

iOS:
- Open App Store
- Search for 'Mojo Selling'
- Tap 'Get' to download
- Install and open

Android:
- Open Google Play Store
- Search for 'Mojo Selling'
- Tap 'Install'
- Open after installation

Initial Setup:

1. Login
- Enter your Mojo username and email
- Enter your password
- Tap 'Sign In'

2. Permissions
- Allow phone permissions (required for calling)
- Allow contacts access (optional but recommended)
- Allow notifications (to receive alerts)
- Allow microphone access (required for calls)

3. Caller ID Whitelist (IMPORTANT)
The mobile app uses AWS Chime for dialing through Mojo servers. To prevent unknown numbers:

- Mojo will display a list of dialer server phone numbers
- Add these numbers to your phone's contacts
- Name them "Mojo Dialer 1", "Mojo Dialer 2", etc.
- This ensures when the app calls you back, it shows "Mojo Dialer" instead of unknown

Typically 5-10 numbers need to be whitelisted depending on your server allocation.

Mobile App Features:

1. Power Dialing
- Access your call lists
- Single-line and click-to-call modes
- (Note: Triple-line dialing not available on mobile)
- Log call results on the go
- Add notes immediately after calls

2. Contact Management
- View full contact database
- Search and filter contacts
- View contact details and history
- Edit contact information
- Add new contacts manually
- Mark contacts as DNC

3. Calendar and Tasks
- View today's tasks
- Check upcoming appointments
- Complete tasks
- Add new follow-ups
- Set reminders

4. Communication
- Make calls through Mojo
- Send emails from the app
- Send SMS messages
- View communication history

5. Lists and Filters
- Access all your call lists
- Apply saved filters
- Create new lists
- Organize contacts

How Mobile Dialing Works:

1. The Mojo app uses AWS Chime technology
2. When you click to call, the app connects to Mojo servers
3. The server calls the contact
4. The server calls your mobile phone
5. When both answer, the calls are bridged
6. You're connected through Mojo's system

Benefits:
- Your personal number stays private (caller ID shows Mojo number)
- Calls are recorded in Mojo
- Works over cellular or WiFi
- Better call quality than direct mobile calls
- Integrated with Mojo features

Mobile vs Web:

Available on Mobile:
✓ Click-to-call and single-line dialing
✓ Contact management
✓ Email and SMS
✓ Calendar and tasks
✓ Call logging
✓ Notes and history

Web/Desktop Only:
✗ Triple-line power dialing
✗ Advanced reporting
✗ Bulk operations
✗ Admin functions
✗ Integrations setup

Tips for Mobile Usage:

1. Stable Connection
- Use WiFi when possible for best quality
- If using cellular, ensure strong signal (4 bars)
- 4G/5G recommended over 3G

2. Battery Management
- Close other apps to save battery
- Bring a portable charger for long sessions
- Lower screen brightness
- Enable low power mode if battery is low

3. Environment
- Use headphones for better audio
- Find quiet location for professional calls
- Avoid driving while using the dialer (safety first!)

4. Data Usage
- Mobile dialing uses approximately 1-2 MB per minute
- WiFi recommended to avoid cellular data charges
- Check your data plan if using mobile data extensively

Troubleshooting Mobile Issues:

1. Can't Login
- Verify username and password are correct
- Check internet connection
- Update app to latest version
- Restart phone and try again

2. No Audio
- Check microphone permissions: Phone Settings > Mojo > Microphone
- Verify volume is turned up
- Try with and without headphones
- Check that phone is not on mute/silent

3. Unknown Numbers Appearing
- You forgot to whitelist dialer server numbers
- Go to Mojo settings in app
- View server numbers
- Add them to your contacts

4. App Crashes
- Update to latest version
- Restart phone
- Clear app cache: Phone Settings > Mojo > Storage > Clear Cache
- Uninstall and reinstall if problems persist

5. Poor Call Quality
- Check internet connection speed
- Switch from WiFi to cellular or vice versa
- Move closer to WiFi router
- Close background apps
- Restart the app

Updating the App:

iOS:
- Open App Store
- Tap your profile icon
- Scroll to find Mojo Selling
- Tap 'Update' if available

Android:
- Open Google Play Store
- Tap menu > My apps & games
- Find Mojo Selling
- Tap 'Update' if available

Best Practices:

1. Use mobile for:
- Callbacks while away from desk
- Following up between appointments
- Quick contact updates
- Checking calendar and tasks

2. Use desktop/web for:
- High-volume power dialing sessions
- Data imports and list management
- Detailed reporting and analytics
- Admin and setup tasks

The mobile app is perfect for agents who are frequently on the go but still want to maintain consistent prospecting activity. It's a complement to the web platform, not a replacement.

title: Calendar, Tasks, and Follow-Up Management
content:
Mojo's Calendar and Task Management system helps you stay organized and ensures no follow-up opportunity is missed.

Calendar Overview:

The Mojo Calendar is your central hub for:
- Follow-up calls
- Appointments
- Email reminders
- Text message tasks
- Custom activities

Viewing Your Calendar:

1. Calendar Views
- Day view: Hour-by-hour schedule
- Week view: 7-day overview
- Month view: Big picture planning
- Today view: Focus on immediate tasks

2. Navigation
- Arrow buttons to move between dates
- Jump to specific date
- Return to today with one click

3. Filtering
- View all activities or filter by type
- Filter by completion status
- Show/hide completed items

Task Types:

1. Call Tasks
- Schedule follow-up calls
- Attach to specific contacts
- Add call objectives/notes
- Mark priority level

2. Email Tasks
- Reminder to send email
- Can link to email templates
- Track completion

3. Text Message Tasks
- SMS follow-up reminders
- Quick message templates
- Log sent messages

4. Appointments
- Property showings
- Listing presentations
- Client meetings
- Include location and details

5. Custom Tasks
- Direct mail reminders
- Property research
- Document preparation
- Any other activity

Creating Follow-Ups:

From Contact Record:
1. Open the contact
2. Click 'Schedule Follow-Up'
3. Choose task type
4. Set date and time
5. Add notes/objectives
6. Save

From Calendar:
1. Click on date/time
2. Select task type
3. Search and select contact
4. Add details
5. Save

Quick Add:
- Click '+' in calendar header
- Fill in quick form
- Save

Task Details:

Each task can include:
- Contact name (linked)
- Date and time
- Task type
- Priority (high, normal, low)
- Notes/objectives
- Assigned agent (for teams)
- Reminder settings

Managing Tasks:

1. Complete Task
- Click checkbox
- Log outcome
- Schedule next follow-up if needed
- Task moves to completed

2. Edit Task
- Click on task
- Modify details
- Save changes

3. Reschedule
- Drag and drop to new time/date
- Or edit and change date

4. Delete Task
- Click task
- Select delete
- Confirm (can't be undone)

Reminders:

Automated Reminders:
- Email notifications
- In-app notifications
- Desktop notifications (browser)

Reminder Timing:
- 15 minutes before
- 30 minutes before
- 1 hour before
- 1 day before
- Custom timing

Configure in Settings > Notifications

Today View:

Your daily command center:
- Shows all tasks due today
- Sorted by time
- Quick complete buttons
- See overdue items highlighted
- Add new tasks quickly

Recommended workflow:
1. Start day by reviewing Today view
2. Prioritize most important tasks
3. Complete tasks and log outcomes
4. Schedule next follow-ups
5. Review at end of day

Integration with Dialing:

When you complete a power dialing session:
- Mojo prompts for follow-up tasks
- Automatically creates tasks for callbacks
- Links to contact records
- Appears in your calendar

Call Result Automation:
- "Call back in 3 days" → auto-creates task
- "Schedule appointment" → creates calendar event
- "Follow up next week" → task for chosen date

Google Calendar Sync:

Mojo can sync with Google Calendar:

1. Enable Sync
- Settings > Integrations > Google Calendar
- Authenticate with Google account
- Choose sync direction:
  * One-way (Mojo → Google only)
  * Two-way (bidirectional sync)

2. What Syncs
- Appointments created in Mojo appear in Google
- (Optional) Google events appear in Mojo
- Updates sync automatically
- Deletions sync

3. Benefits
- View Mojo tasks in your phone's calendar app
- Coordinate with personal calendar
- Share availability with others
- Get mobile reminders

Team Features:

For teams and brokerages:

1. Task Assignment
- Assign tasks to specific agents
- Round-robin distribution
- Territory-based routing

2. Team Calendar View
- See all team member calendars
- Coordinate activities
- Identify who's working what

3. Load Balancing
- View task distribution
- Rebalance if needed
- Ensure fair lead distribution

Reports:

Calendar Reporting:
- Task completion rates
- Average follow-up time
- Most common task types
- Agent productivity comparison
- Conversion rates by task type

Access via Reports > Activity Reports

Best Practices:

1. Schedule Immediately
- Don't rely on memory
- Schedule next follow-up right after call
- Better to over-schedule than miss opportunities

2. Add Context
- Write notes about previous conversation
- Include specific talking points for next call
- Reference previous discussion
- Future-you will thank present-you

3. Time Block
- Group similar tasks together
- "Call block" from 9-11am
- "Email block" from 1-2pm
- More efficient than constant switching

4. Review Weekly
- Sunday evening or Monday morning
- Look at week ahead
- Identify busy days
- Prepare for important tasks

5. Clean Up Regularly
- Don't let old tasks pile up
- Complete or delete outdated items
- Keep calendar current
- Archive completed items

6. Use Priorities
- Not everything is urgent
- Mark truly important items as high priority
- Focus on high-value activities
- Nice-to-dos can wait

Mobile Calendar:

The Mojo mobile app includes full calendar access:
- View all tasks and appointments
- Complete tasks on the go
- Add new follow-ups
- Receive mobile reminders
- Sync with Google Calendar

Perfect for agents who are frequently out showing properties or in meetings.

Common Pitfalls to Avoid:

1. Over-scheduling
- Leave buffer time between tasks
- Account for drive time
- Don't pack every minute
- Allow for unexpected opportunities

2. Vague Notes
- "Call John" is not helpful
- Better: "Call John Smith re: 123 Main St showing feedback"
- Include context and purpose

3. Ignoring Overdue
- Overdue tasks don't age well
- Either complete, reschedule, or delete
- Don't let them pile up

4. Not Using Reminders
- Set reminders for important items
- Prevent forgotten appointments
- Stay on top of time-sensitive tasks

The Calendar and Task system in Mojo is designed to ensure consistent follow-up, which is the key to converting leads into clients. Use it diligently and you'll see your conversion rates improve.

title: Reports and Analytics
content:
Mojo provides comprehensive reporting and analytics to measure your prospecting performance and identify areas for improvement.

Report Types:

1. Agent Activity Report

Shows individual agent performance:
- Total calls made
- Talk time (total and average)
- Contacts made (live conversations)
- Contact rate (contacts ÷ calls)
- Calls per hour
- Best calling times
- Call results breakdown

Filters:
- Date range (today, yesterday, week, month, custom)
- Specific agent(s)
- Call list
- Time of day

Use to:
- Measure daily productivity
- Compare agent performance
- Identify training opportunities
- Set performance goals

2. Call Results Report

Breaks down call dispositions:
- Contact Made
- Left Message
- No Answer
- Wrong Number
- Do Not Call
- Appointment Set
- Custom results

Shows:
- Count and percentage of each result
- Trends over time
- Comparison between agents
- Conversion rates

Use to:
- Understand call outcomes
- Calculate conversion rates
- Identify data quality issues (high wrong numbers)
- Track appointments set

3. Lead Source Report

Analyzes performance by lead source:
- Contacts by source
- Conversion rate by source
- Cost per lead (if entered)
- ROI by source
- Time to conversion

Sources tracked:
- Vulcan7, RedX, ListSource, etc.
- Web leads
- Referrals
- Open houses
- Direct mail responses
- Custom sources

Use to:
- Identify best-performing lead sources
- Make data-driven purchasing decisions
- Allocate marketing budget effectively
- Discontinue poor-performing sources

4. Dialer Session Report

Tracks power dialing sessions:
- Session start and end times
- Duration of each session
- Total calls in session
- Contacts made
- Appointments set
- Average time per call
- Dialer efficiency metrics

Filters:
- Date range
- Agent
- Session type (triple, single, click-to-call)

Use to:
- Measure dialing efficiency
- Compare session productivity
- Identify optimal session length
- Track break times

5. Email Performance Report

Email marketing metrics:
- Emails sent
- Open rate
- Click-through rate
- Bounce rate
- Unsubscribe rate
- Best-performing subject lines
- Optimal send times

By email:
- Individual email performance
- Template comparison
- A/B test results

By recipient:
- Engagement by contact
- Email response rate
- Conversion from email

Use to:
- Improve email copy
- Optimize send times
- Clean email list (remove bounces)
- Measure email campaign ROI

6. Contact Analysis Report

Database health metrics:
- Total contacts
- Contacts by status
- Contacts by tag
- Last contact date distribution
- Phone number quality
- Email availability
- Stale leads (not contacted recently)

Use to:
- Assess database quality
- Identify neglected leads
- Plan cleanup activities
- Segment for targeted campaigns

7. Appointments Report

Track scheduled appointments:
- Appointments set
- Appointments completed
- Show rate (completion ÷ scheduled)
- No-show rate
- Conversion rate (appointment → client)
- Revenue from appointments (if tracked)

Filters:
- Date range
- Agent
- Appointment type
- Outcome

Use to:
- Measure appointment-setting effectiveness
- Calculate show rates
- Identify patterns in no-shows
- Track conversion funnel

Accessing Reports:

1. Navigate to Reports menu
2. Select report type
3. Set date range and filters
4. Click 'Generate Report'
5. View in browser

Exporting Reports:

All reports can be exported:
- PDF: For printing or sharing
- CSV: For Excel analysis
- Email: Schedule automatic delivery

Export options:
- One-time export (download now)
- Scheduled reports (daily, weekly, monthly)
- Email to recipients automatically

Scheduled Reports:

Automate report delivery:

1. Generate desired report
2. Click 'Schedule'
3. Choose frequency:
   - Daily (every morning)
   - Weekly (Monday mornings)
   - Monthly (1st of month)
4. Enter email recipients
5. Save schedule

Great for:
- Team managers reviewing agent performance
- Brokers tracking office productivity
- Agents receiving daily activity summary
- Accountability and motivation

Dashboard:

Quick-view dashboard shows:
- Today's activity at a glance
- Week-to-date metrics
- Month-to-date metrics
- Goals and progress
- Trending up/down indicators

Customize dashboard widgets:
- Drag to rearrange
- Hide/show specific metrics
- Set personal goals
- View team goals

Key Performance Indicators (KPIs):

Critical metrics to monitor:

1. Contact Rate
- Contacts made ÷ calls dialed
- Industry average: 10-15%
- Higher is better
- Low rate = data quality or timing issues

2. Dial-to-Appointment Ratio
- Appointments set ÷ total calls
- Industry average: 1-3%
- Varies by lead quality
- Track trend over time

3. Appointment Show Rate
- Appointments kept ÷ scheduled
- Target: 60-70%
- Low rate = confirmation process needs work

4. Calls Per Hour
- Total calls ÷ dialing time
- Triple-line average: 50-80
- Single-line average: 20-30
- Efficiency indicator

5. Conversion Rate
- Clients gained ÷ appointments
- Varies widely by market and service
- Track by lead source and agent

Goal Setting:

Set and track goals in Mojo:

1. Daily Goals
- Calls dialed
- Contacts made
- Appointments set
- Visual progress bars

2. Weekly Goals
- Same metrics over a week
- Good for part-time agents

3. Monthly Goals
- Bigger picture targets
- Revenue goals (if tracked)
- New clients acquired

Goals visible on:
- Dashboard
- Reports header
- Mobile app

Motivation and gamification through visual progress.

Team Reporting:

Managers and brokers can view:

1. Team Dashboard
- All agents' performance
- Team totals and averages
- Leaderboard
- Top performers

2. Comparative Reports
- Side-by-side agent comparison
- Best practices identification
- Coaching opportunities

3. Office Metrics
- Overall office productivity
- Department comparison
- Month-over-month growth

Best Practices:

1. Review Daily
- Check your dashboard every morning
- Know your numbers
- Adjust activity based on results

2. Analyze Weekly
- Deep dive into weekly reports
- Identify trends
- Celebrate wins
- Diagnose problems

3. Plan Monthly
- Review monthly performance
- Set next month's goals
- Budget and forecasting
- Strategic adjustments

4. Use Data to Guide Action
- Low contact rate? Check data quality or call times.
- High no-show rate? Improve confirmation process.
- Great source performance? Double down investment.
- Poor conversion? Focus on scripting and training.

5. Share Success
- Celebrate good numbers with team
- Recognition motivates
- Share best practices
- Learn from top performers

The reports in Mojo give you the insights needed to continuously improve your prospecting performance. As the saying goes: "What gets measured gets managed." Use these tools to measure everything, and watch your results improve.
